title: This assignment tests you on  how to create and use array object in the java program.

questionText.text:
Given an array of ints, return true if the arrays of length are 1 or more, and the first element and the last element are equal.
sameFirstLast([1, 2, 3]) → false
sameFirstLast([1, 2, 3, 1]) → true
sameFirstLast([1, 2, 1]) → true
Check your program against test cases below as a zip file. Submit your solution(zip file) when all test cases are passed

title: This activity tests you on how to create, use an array as an object in function which in turn should return an array as the return value in the function.

questionText.text:
Given an array of ints with length 3, return a new array with the elements in reverse order, so {1, 2, 3} becomes {3, 2, 1}.
reverse3([1, 2, 3]) → [3, 2, 1]
reverse3([5, 11, 9]) → [9, 11, 5]
reverse3([7, 0, 0]) → [0, 0, 7]

sameFirstLast([1, 2, 1]) → true
Check your program against test cases below as a zip file. Submit your solution(zip file) when all test cases are passed

title: This activity tests you on how to iterate array object with array length, by using different loops in Java.

questionText.text:
Given n>=0, create an array length n*n with the following pattern, shown here for n=3 : 
{0, 0, 1,    0, 2, 1,    3, 2, 1}
(spaces added to show the 3 groups).
squareUp(3) → [0, 0, 1, 0, 2, 1, 3, 2, 1]
squareUp(2) → [0, 1, 2, 1]
squareUp(4) → [0, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0, 2, 1, 0, 3, 2, 1, 4, 3, 2, 1]
Check your program against test cases below as a zip file. Submit your solution(zip file) when all test cases are passed

title: This activity tests you on how to perform operations on the array elements and store the end result in the different indices.

questionText.text:
Return an array that contains exactly the same numbers as the given array, but rearranged so that every 4 is immediately followed by a 5. Do not move the 4's, but every other number may move. The array contains the same number of 4's and 5's, and every 4 has a number after it that is not a 4. In this version, 5's may appear anywhere in the original array.
fix45([5, 4, 9, 4, 9, 5]) → [9, 4, 5, 4, 5, 9]
fix45([1, 4, 1, 5]) → [1, 4, 5, 1]
fix45([1, 4, 1, 5, 5, 4, 1]) → [1, 4, 5, 1, 1, 4, 5]
Check your program against test cases below as a zip file. Submit your solution(zip file) when all test cases are passed
